snippet: Facing public anger and internal divisions after the assassination of an opposition leader, the Ennahda party did not seem to look inward.
abstract: Memo From Tunis; Ennahda, Tunisia's largest Islamist party and leader of governing coalition, blames news media, secular elites and remnants of old government for its troubles, in face of public anger and internal divisions after assassination of opposition leader Chokri Belaid.
lead_paragraph: Facing public anger and internal divisions after the assassination of an opposition leader, the Ennahda party did not seem to look inward.

headline.seo: Memo From Tunis: Ennahda Party Rejects Blame for Tunisia’s Troubles
headline.main: Ruling Islamists, Under Attack, Reject Blame for Tunisia’s Woes
headline.print_headline: Ruling Islamists, Under Attack, Reject Blame for Tunisia’s Woes

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
